pullRequest.body:
The recently added file CdfToKernel contains generalizations of many lemmas in the file CondCdf. This PR refactors CondCdf to use the new results.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body: Could you add a comment in the file-level docstring how most things are deduced from the more general ` CdfToKernel`, and how the notions are related?

:v: RemyDegenne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Could you take advantage of this PR to try to find a better home for these lemmas (and use them in the other file)?

I found out there is another PR open about removing those lemmas: #10298
Given that they should be deleted soon, I moved them to CdfToKernel to be able to use them in that file, but did not look for a better place.

I realize just now that I missed something on the previous PR: the naming convention would require `IsRatCondKernelCDFAux`. Could you change it now? (No need to deprecate the statements, it's recent enough).

```suggestion
We build towards the definition of `ProbabilityTheory.condCDF`. We first define
```
